channel.title: Woodcutting skill
channel.description:
how do i make the tree case so the tree will fall down after a certain amount of logs it puts out?
something like
[code] case: 1234 //tree addSkillXP(1000, 8); //add xp addItem(995, 100000); // add cash setAnimation(123); //cutting emote break; [/code]
but now, how do i set it when it is clicked the tree turns into a tree stump and comes back at xxx time and how do i do it with other trees that take like 10-15 logs to fall down into a stump? what are the commands to make the trees fall after x many of logs and come back 'alive' in x number of minutes... (or seconds)

item.dc:creator: @Pk_Lord_Pker Pk Lord Pker

Use the search , and see how to make a int
[/quote]

lol good idea ha[/quote]

thanks , lol.

item.title: Woodcutting skill
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

[quote=“firewithin3, post:7, topic:245475”][quote author=lesterknome link=topic=321913.msg2545215#msg2545215 date=1227234048]
:rolleyes: well…
public int tree = 0;

If(tree = 0;))
Add
Something like that
[/quote]I love how in your signature, you’re telling people to become “coders” when you can’t do a simple if statement, plus, that logic is fail just creating an int and checking if it’s true or not, you would have to add more methods or code that actually does something. If you were going to do simple shit like what you attempted to do, it would be:

public int tree = 0;
if (tree == 0) {
//do something in here
}
else {
//do something else here
}

That still wouldn’t do a damn thing, but it’s better than your failcode. Please remove your signature, because you have no right to be telling people to become “coders” when you can’t make a simple if statement that doesn’t do anything.[/quote]
I was guessing it wouldn’t… lol. And in my sig i was trying to get people to stop flaming mods

Read full topic

Something like that
[/quote]I love how in your signature, you’re telling people to become “coders” when you can’t do a simple if statement, plus, that logic is fail just creating an int and checking if it’s true or not, you would have to add more methods or code that actually does something. If you were going to do simple shit like what you attempted to do, it would be:

public int tree = 0;
if (tree == 0) {
//do something in here
}
else {
//do something else here
}

That still wouldn’t do a damn thing, but it’s better than your failcode. Please remove your signature, because you have no right to be telling people to become “coders” when you can’t make a simple if statement that doesn’t do anything.[/quote]

So true. So, so true.

Anyway, you could easily make some crap too by just making it so everytime you receive a log or money it adds to an int, but it will clog your process but you could make it replace the object doing that. Try checking All-Star’s normal tree, it has the ability to turn into a stump.

item.title: Woodcutting skill

[quote=“lesterknome, post:4, topic:245475”]:rolleyes: well…
public int tree = 0;

If(tree = 0;))
Add
Something like that[/quote]I love how in your signature, you’re telling people to become “coders” when you can’t do a simple if statement, plus, that logic is fail just creating an int and checking if it’s true or not, you would have to add more methods or code that actually does something. If you were going to do simple shit like what you attempted to do, it would be:

public int tree = 0;
if (tree == 0) {
//do something in here
}
else {
//do something else here
}

That still wouldn’t do a damn thing, but it’s better than your failcode. Please remove your signature, because you have no right to be telling people to become “coders” when you can’t make a simple if statement that doesn’t do anything.
